games.name: Dead Cells
games.caption: Dead Cells Game
games.description: In the game, the player takes the role of a slime-like creature that takes control of a corpse in a dungeon, through which they must fight their way out.

games.name: FEZ
games.caption: FEZ Game
games.description: The player-character Gomez receives a fez that reveals his two-dimensional (2D) world to be one of four sides of a three-dimensional (3D) world.

games.name: Oddworld
games.caption: Oddworld Game
games.description: Oddworld is the name of the planet on which all four Oddworld Inhabitants games are based, extant in another dimension.

games.name: Journey
games.caption: Journey Game
games.description: In Journey, the player takes the role of a robed figure in a desert.

games.name: Rayman Legends
games.caption: Rayman Legends Game
games.description: Its plot takes place one century after the events of Rayman Origins. Rayman, Globox and the Teensies have been sleeping for a century.

games.name: INSIDE
games.caption: INSIDE Game
games.description: The player character is an unnamed boy who explores a surreal and mostly monochromatic environment presented as a 2.5D platform game. The game is dark, with color used sparingly to highlight both the player and certain parts of the environment.

games.name: Never Alone(Kisima Inŋitchuŋa)
games.caption: Never Alone Game
games.description: The player-character plays as the Iñupiaq girl Nuna and her Arctic fox.

games.name: Limbo
games.caption: Limbo Game
games.description: The dark visuals serve to conceal numerous lethal surprises, including such environmental and physical hazards as deadly bear traps on the forest floor, or lethal monsters hiding in the shadows.

games.name: Diablo III
games.caption: Diablo Game
games.description: As in Diablo II, multiplayer games are possible using Blizzard's Battle.net service,[6] with many of the new features developed for StarCraft II also available in Diablo III.
